captions.text:
In a world created by fat computer programmers,
comes a film so epic, it increased ticket

Meet Jake Sully, a marine who is contacted
by the government because his dead twin brother,

Tommy, was part of a secret scientific program
that engineered expensive synthetic Avatar

bodies capable of being driven by human drivers
when wired into a computer, but only if the

DNA genomes of the driver and Avatar body
match, which Jake’s does because he’s

So the government takes advantage of this
fact by asking Jake to drive Tomy’s Avatar

body to a rich deposit of space coal called
Unobtanium, which is sitting under a tree

called Home Tree, which is occupied by the
native people called the Na’vi.

Meet Neytiri. But more importantly, meet her
side-bloobs.

Travel to a futuristic world of spaceships,
Mech-Warriors and...

Follow along with a team of scientists who
blend in with the natives by wearing the GAP

Discover the Na’vi, a strong and noble race
of blue Indians, fully in-tune with nature,

who are somehow helpless without the white
man.

It’s actually kind of offensive when you
think about it.

This December, prepare for three hours of
eyeball twitching.

As you’re force-fed the most obvious message
ever.

Ugh. We get it. We’ll recycle. Please, just
make another Terminator already.

Tell us what movie you want to see as an Honest
Trailer next and leave a comment with a word

you’d like to hear me say in my awesome
voice.
Remember to like, comment, and subscribe.

comments.text:
I hate the whole "saved by the white man" bit.

It's not that at all. The "white man" is representative of the human race 
who has come to strip their planet of it's resources and the natives are 
not equipped to deal with the invaders so it takes one of the enemy to lead 
them in the fight to reclaim their land.

It's nothing to do with white or anything like that. And anyone who can't 
see it is being pretty silly.﻿
